ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, I recommend it. A great way to learn about both history and law. An understanding of how people have come to own living intellectual property is highly important in the history of science and technology and also informs ongoing debates on biotechnology.

Though the course title appears to be esoteric at first, the class material presents a great historical narrative of the increasingly relevant role of the biotech industry. I would definitely recommend this course to anyone who is interested in understanding the interplay between patent law, innovation and monopoly in biotechnology since the 19th century. The weeks dealing with GMO and gene patenting controversies were probably the best part of this course.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
